WHEELER H. PECKHAM.
FRANCIS BLOODGOOD.
LAW AND COLLECTION OFFICES
OF
PECKHAM & BLOODGOOD.

Milwaukee, March 1st 1865
To His Excellency
Thomas E Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky
Sir

I would respectfully solicite the appointment of Comms of Deeds for your State. Besides being commissioner for both the National and State Courts, I am Commissioner of Deeds for most of the Loyal states; and hold myself constantly in readiness for the discharge of the duties thereof. It would therefore be a Matter of convenience to parties desiring such offices, if I held a similar commission under your authority, In support of my application, I offer the accompanying testimonials.

Hoping for an early and favorable response
I remain your obt servant
Francis Bloodgood
